title: Txog Hmoob Kev Lag Luam
subtitle: Xov txog Hmoob Lub Neej thiab Kev Cai

hero.description: Saib txog Hmoob kev dag, kev cai, thiab kev paub tshiab ntawm Hmoob community hnub tom ntej. Starting from ancient ceremonies to daily village life, experience the beauty of a culture that has preserved its identity across generations.

newYear.title: Hmoob Tub Ntxhais Kawm - Noj Peb Caug
newYear.subtitle: Kev Hlub Ntshiab ntawm Hmoob
newYear.description: Hmoob New Year, tom qab mus rau xyoo, yog qhov tshaj plaws Hmoob cultural festival marking the end of the harvest season and the beginning of a new year. It is a time for honor, spirit, and community bonding.
traditions: Pov pob - ball tossing between young men and women
Hmoov xyaum - colorful traditional clothing with embroidery
Lauj, qeej, thiab ncas - music, dance, and performances
Noj mov - feasting with family and community
Hu plig - honoring ancestors and blessings
newYear.duration: Celebrated for 3-7 days, typically in November or December

farming.title: Kev Haum Xyaum Hmoob
farming.subtitle: Ua haum rau ntawm yaj
farming.description: Agriculture has been the cornerstone of Hmoob life for centuries. Hmoob farmers have developed sustainable farming practices adapted to mountainous regions, growing rice, corn, vegetables, and herbs.
practices: Haum mov rau sab ncauj - rice cultivation on terraced fields
Kee haum xyaum - sustainable farming techniques
Haum nkhaus thiab ntsuab - growing vegetables and herbs
Sib tw haum rooj, mov, thiab kwv - animal husbandry
Tee pob - preserving seeds for future seasons
farming.philosophy: Work with nature, respect the land, and share the harvest

wedding.title: Hmoob Xyoo Hnub
wedding.subtitle: Kev Sib Hlub Nkawj
wedding.description: Hmoob weddings are elaborate multi-day celebrations filled with meaningful rituals, symbolic exchanges, and community participation. The ceremony binds not just two individuals, but two families together.
traditions: Nqee hnyuj - negotiation of bride price
Bride's departure ceremony from her family home
Xyoo hnub feast with traditional foods and music
Exchange of gifts and blessings between families
The groom's journey to bring the bride to his home
wedding.symbolism: Weddings symbolize the union of lineages and the continuation of Hmoob traditions

villageLife.title: Nroog Hmoob thiab Me Nyuam
villageLife.subtitle: Growing Up in Community
villageLife.description: Hmoob villages are close-knit communities where children grow up surrounded by extended family, learning traditions, language, and values through daily life and play.
activities: Me nyuam playing traditional games in village squares
Learning traditional crafts and skills from elders
Helping with family chores and farming
Storytelling sessions that preserve oral history
villageLife.values: Respect, community cooperation, and preservation of cultural identity

values.title: Hmoob Tsev Neeg
values.subtitle: Principles That Guide Our Way of Life

items.title: Tsev Neeg First
items.description: Family is the center of Hmoob society, with strong emphasis on respecting elders and caring for children

items.title: Community Unity
items.description: Collective well-being and mutual support are essential for community prosperity

items.title: Cultural Preservation
items.description: Passing down traditions, language, and customs to future generations

items.title: Harmony with Nature
items.description: Living sustainably and respecting the natural environment
